column1: Bark pl. baruk is a Khuzdul word which means "axe".
It is another example of "broken plurals" in Khuzdul
It is possible that "baruk" is also a genitive case
column2: meaning "axes of " rather than just "axes". The phrase "baruk Khazâd" can be compared to a "construct pair" in Semitic languages
column3: such as Hebrew and Arabic.Magnus Åberg
